description: A live music performance by a single artist or band, often held in a dedicated concert venue.
A multi-day event featuring various artists across multiple stages, often themed by genre or season.
A music event held in a nightclub or bar, often featuring DJs or smaller live performances.
A small-scale, formal performance, often featuring classical or solo instrumental music.

An outdoor music event, often held in large open spaces like parks, fields, or stadiums. Open-air events range from small gatherings to massive festivals and provide a relaxed atmosphere with natural surroundings. Weather is a key factor, as these events rely on favorable conditions to enhance the live music experience.
An event where audience members or emerging artists perform in front of an audience, usually in a casual venue.
A classical music performance combining orchestral music, singing, and dramatic staging.
A large instrumental ensemble performance, typically playing classical or symphonic pieces.
A competitive event where bands perform to win based on audience or judge votes.
A performance where a DJ plays and mixes music, often at a club or electronic music event.
A concert organized to raise funds or awareness for a specific cause or charity.
A performance focusing on acoustic instruments, often in an intimate or unplugged setting.
A staged theatrical performance combining music, songs, dance, and dialogue.
An informal live performance held outdoors, often by individual musicians or small groups.
An event where participants sing along to backing tracks in front of an audience, often in a bar or club.
A concert dedicated to the music of a specific artist or band, performed by other musicians.
An event celebrating the release of a new album, often featuring a live performance by the artist.
An informal gathering of musicians who play and improvise together, often in jazz or blues.
An event where the audience is encouraged to sing along, often to popular or well-known songs.
A choral music event featuring a group of singers performing harmonized vocal music.
A large, often all-night event featuring electronic music, typically with DJ sets and dance floors.
An event where participants wear wireless headphones to listen to music rather than through speakers.
A street performance, often by solo musicians or small groups, aiming to engage with passersby.
An intimate concert held in a private home, featuring close-up performances by the artist.
An event where individuals perform in various musical or other artistic categories, often with judges or voting.
A sudden, usually unannounced performance in a public space, often organized for surprise impact.
A performance where the audience is encouraged to interact with the music, such as through clapping or singing.
An event focused on teaching or learning specific musical skills, often hands-on and interactive.
An immersive event using sound as an artistic medium, often in an exhibit or gallery setting.
A live event where musicians improvise without a fixed setlist, often drawing from audience suggestions.
A music event held in a restaurant or dining setting, with music provided alongside meal service.
A performance where multiple shorter songs are performed in sequence, often by a single artist or group.
A casual gathering to listen to a specific album or artist, often in anticipation of a new release.
An event focusing on a particular composerâ€™s work, with various pieces performed by different musicians.
A competition where vocalists perform against each other, with audience or judge voting.
A small group performance, such as a quartet or quintet, focused on coordinated instrumental or vocal music.
A semi-public rehearsal where musicians practice in front of an invited audience for feedback.
An instructional event where experienced musicians teach and demonstrate to students or audience members.
A public or semi-public performance where musicians perform for judges or potential roles in productions.
A concert celebrating a milestone, such as a band's formation, or an album release anniversary.
A music event accompanied by intricate light displays or projections, enhancing the visual experience.
A gallery or museum exhibit with interactive musical elements, where sound plays a central role.
An immersive event using sound waves and vibrations, often with instruments like gongs and singing bowls, aimed at relaxation and meditation.
A music event where ambient music plays continuously, often with visuals or lighting to create a relaxing atmosphere.
A series of performances by a single artist or group over multiple nights, often in the same venue.
An intimate event where multiple songwriters perform their songs in turn, often with storytelling about the song's creation.
An event using surround sound or binaural audio technology to create an immersive listening environment.
An organized walk where participants listen to the sounds of the environment, sometimes with live or recorded soundscapes.
An installation or small booth where attendees can privately listen to curated music or sound art pieces.
A live performance of an album with a specific narrative or theme, often performed in sequence as a cohesive story.
A live music performance in a dimly lit venue filled with candles, creating an intimate and atmospheric setting.
A set of recurring performances by different artists, often in the same genre or style, hosted by a single venue over time.
A live event where audience members request songs in real time, with performers adapting to the selections.
A live music event combined with projection mapping visuals that enhance the performance space or stage.
A spontaneous, unannounced live music performance in a public or unexpected location.
A concert that combines a live, in-person audience with a simultaneous online streaming audience.
An event where composers or musicians create new music live in front of an audience, sometimes incorporating audience input.
An event where performers quickly present short, original compositions in front of a live audience, similar to poetry slams.
A performance focused on vocal-only arrangements, showcasing acapella groups or solo vocalists.
An avant-garde event featuring experimental noise music, often focusing on unconventional sounds and feedback.
A performance designed for relaxation and wellness, often with slow-paced music and a peaceful atmosphere.
A dance event where the DJ or musicians interact directly with the crowd, taking requests or guiding group activities.
An event where live performers act out a concert or music video in sync with a recorded track, often adding a theatrical element.
An informal music event held in a backyard, often with a smaller audience and an intimate setting.
A circular gathering where musicians share songs and stories in turns, usually acoustically and in an intimate setting.
A music event that begins late at night, often intended to create a unique or surreal atmosphere.
An installation that uses sounds in a space, allowing attendees to walk around and interact with different soundscapes.
A live performance held on a rooftop, offering unique views and an outdoor atmosphere.
An event combining live music with a charity auction, where items or experiences are auctioned for fundraising.
A performance centered around loop stations, with artists building layered sounds live in front of the audience.
A casual event where participants listen to vinyl records, often curated around a theme or artist.
A performance recreating a specific eraâ€™s music, often with period costumes and decor to set the atmosphere.
An event combining music and synchronized lighting effects, often for a dramatic and immersive experience.
A cozy, informal music session often held in a lounge or living room setting with a small audience.
An educational event where attendees, especially kids, can try out different musical instruments with guidance.
A collaborative event where participants contribute to writing and composing a song in real time.
An outdoor concert timed with the setting sun, often aiming to capture the natural ambiance of dusk.
An immersive event featuring ambient soundscapes, often inspired by nature or specific themes.
A performance combining music with other sensory elements like scents, lighting, or temperature changes.
A short, often 15-20 minute live music performance in a very small, intimate setting.
